page.title: 08Roads and Transport
page.content: The roads are minor,narrow and twisting with restricted visibility. Traffic uses the north-south route when travelling between Dunstable and Hemel Hempstead.At the centre of Studham is a crossroads one road being Dunstable Road. Hannah (Age 6) Dunstable road is not wide enough for a car and bus together. Often there is a traffic jam. Buses run infrequently to Dunstable and Hemel Hempstead. The last bus from Dunstable to Studham leaves at 21.20 The nearest railway stations are at Luton and Hemel Hempstead. Most families have at least one car. Coaches are used by most children to travel to/from their schools in Studham and Dunstable. Traffic Survey Studham 14.6.1985 at 1330: 18 cars in 15 minutes.
